1:
Call Waveguide with -> obj.Waveguide(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Waveguide Geometry ---
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide in micrometers.
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Side angle of the waveguide walls.
        Calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 2 entries.
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material']
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut"]

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2:
Call MMI2x1 with -> obj.MMI2x1(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 2 entries.
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material']
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut"]
    Parameters['Cladding'] : optional
        If provided, adds a cladding layer over the MMI structure.
        Example: Parameters['Cladding'] = 1

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : int/float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.
        Example: Parameters['Substrate Height'] = 600

    --- MMI Geometry ---
    Parameters['MMI Width'] : float
        Width of the MMI region.
    Parameters['MMI Length'] : float
        Length of the MMI region.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Angle of the waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height; also sets the MMI section height.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.

    --- Waveguide Placement ---
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between waveguides. If Taper=True, offset applies to the taper wider sides.
        Minimum distance = 1 um due to manufacturing constraints.
    Parameters['Offset Input'] : float
        Offset of the input waveguide.
    Parameters['Offset Output'] : optional
        Moves the outputs in the opposite direction (used for machine limitations).

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        True → taper applied
        False → no taper
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of taper if Taper=True. Ignored if Taper=False.
    Parameters['Taper Width'] : float
        Width of taper if Taper=True. Ignored if Taper=False.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str

    --- Substrate ---

    --- MMI Geometry ---
    Parameters['MMI Width'] : float
        Width of the MMI region.
    Parameters['MMI Length'] : float
        Length of the MMI region.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Angle of the waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height; also sets the MMI section height.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.

    --- Waveguide Placement ---
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between waveguides. If Taper=True, offset applies to the taper wider sides.
        Minimum distance = 1 um due to manufacturing constraints.

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        True → taper applied
        False → no taper
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of taper if Taper=True. Ignored if Taper=False.
    Parameters['Taper Width'] : float
        Width of taper if Taper=True. Ignored if Taper=False.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6:
Call StraightWaveguide with -> obj.StraightWaveguide(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : int/float
        Height of the substrate.
        Example: Parameters['Substrate Height'] = 600

    --- Waveguide Geometry ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : int/float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : int/float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : int/float
        Length of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : int/float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['angle'] : int/float
        Angle of the waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 2 entries.
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material']
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut"]
    Parameters['Cladding'] : optional
        If provided, adds a cladding layer over the waveguide.
        Example: Parameters['Cladding'] = 1

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        If False → only waveguide is constructed
        If True → a single taper is constructed
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : int/float
        Length of the taper.
    Parameters['Taper Width'] : int/float
        Backside width of the taper. Frontside width equals waveguide width.
    Parameters['Taper Type'] : optional
        If provided, designs an inverse taper structure with no cladding.
        Example: Parameters['Taper Type'] = 1
        Additional required keys if Taper Type is used:
            TaperWidthF = Parameters['PWB Taper Width Front']
            TaperWidthB = Parameters['PWB Taper Width Back']
            TaperHeightB = Parameters['PWB Taper Height Back']
            TaperHeightF = Parameters['PWB Taper Height Front']
            TaperLength_PWB = Parameters['PWB Taper Length']

    --- Simulation Options ---
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : int/float
        Simulation wavelength in micrometers.
    Parameters['Waveguide Angle'] : int/float
        Bending angle of the waveguide. Set 0 for a straight waveguide.
        Non-zero values tilt the waveguide by the chosen angle.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8:
Call BendWaveguide with -> obj.BendWaveguide(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : int/float
        Height of the substrate.
        Example: Parameters['Substrate Height'] = 600

    --- Waveguide Geometry ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : int/float
        Height of the waveguide (etching depth).
    Parameters['WG Width'] : int/float
        Top width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : int/float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['angle'] : int/float
        Angle of the waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 2 entries.
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material']
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut"]

    --- Simulation Options ---
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : int/float
        Simulation wavelength in micrometers.

    --- Bend Geometry ---
    Parameters['x span'] : float
        Length of the S-curve in the x direction.
    Parameters['y span'] : float
        Height of the S-curve (difference between input and output ports) in the y direction.
    Parameters['poles'] : bool
        Curve type.
        True → Bezier curve will be made
        False → Cosine curve will be made:
            y(t) = y_span * (cos((pi / (2 * x_span)) * t))^2
            where t is in the range 0 to x_span

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9:
Call ArcWaveguide with -> obj.ArcWaveguide(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : int/float
        Height of the substrate.
        Example: Parameters['Substrate Height'] = 600

    --- Waveguide Geometry ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : int/float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : int/float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : int/float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['angle'] : int/float
        Angle of the waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 2 entries.
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material']
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut"]
    Parameters['Cladding'] : optional
        If provided, adds a cladding layer over the waveguide.
        Example: Parameters['Cladding'] = 1

    --- Simulation Options ---
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : int/float
        Simulation wavelength in micrometers.

    --- Arc Geometry ---
    Parameters['S_Band Radius'] : float
        Radius of the circle in micrometers.
    Parameters['Arc deg'] : int
        Arc angle in degrees. Can be 90 (1/4 circle) or 180 (1/2 circle).

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7:
Call WDM with -> obj.WDM(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 2 entries.
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material']
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut"]
    Parameters['Cladding'] : optional
        If provided, adds a cladding layer over the WDM structure.
        Example: Parameters['Cladding'] = 1

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- MMI Geometry ---
    Parameters['MMI Width'] : float
        Width of the MMI region.
    Parameters['MMI Length'] : float
        Length of the MMI region.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Angle of the waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height; also sets the MMI section height.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Wavelength for simulation.

    --- Waveguide Placement ---
    Parameters['Angle Theta'] : float
        Input/output angle of the waveguides (temporary feature).
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between waveguides (if applicable).

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        True → tapers applied
        False → no tapers
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of taper if Taper=True. Ignored if Taper=False.
    Parameters['Taper Width'] : float
        Width of taper if Taper=True. Ignored if Taper=False.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4:
Call InverseTaper with -> obj.InverseTaper(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 3 entries for this structure.
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material', 'Third Material']
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut", "Another Material"]

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Waveguide Geometry ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide; also sets the MMI section height.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide. In this function, this defines the **inverse taper width**.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Angle of the waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Inverse Taper ---
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the inverse taper.
    Parameters['Taper Width'] : float
        Front width of the inverse taper. Only used in this function.

    --- Photonic Wirebonding (PWB) ---
    Parameters['PWB Taper Width Back'] : float
        Width of the back side of the PWB taper.
    Parameters['PWB Taper Height Back'] : float
        Height of the back side of the PWB taper.
    Parameters['PWB Taper Width Front'] : float
        Width of the front side of the PWB taper (toward the photonic waveguide).
    Parameters['PWB Taper Height Front'] : float
        Height of the front side of the PWB taper (toward the photonic waveguide).
    Parameters['PWB Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the PWB taper.

    --- Single Mode Fiber (SMF) ---
    Parameters['SMF Core Diameter'] : float
        Diameter of the SMF core.
    Parameters['SMF Cladding Diameter'] : float
        Diameter of the SMF cladding.
    Parameters['SMF Core Index'] : float
        Refractive index of the SMF core.
    Parameters['SMF Cladding Index'] : float
        Refractive index of the SMF cladding.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5:
Call DirectionalCoupler with -> obj.DirectionalCoupler(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 3 entries:
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material', 'Photonic Wire Bonding']
        Example: Parameters['Material'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut", "Si (Silicon) - Palik"]

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.
    Parameters['Substrate Width'] : float
        Width of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Directional Coupler Geometry ---
    Parameters['DC Length'] : float
        Length of the directional coupler.
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height; also the height of the MMI section.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Angle of the waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Waveguide Placement ---
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between waveguides. Minimum distance = 1 µm due to manufacturing restrictions.

    --- Optical ---
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Wavelength of operation in micrometers.

    --- Optional ---
    Parameters['Cladding'] : anything, optional
        If set, a cladding layer will be applied over the structure.
        Example: Parameters["Cladding"] = 1

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10:
Call GratingCoupler with -> obj.GratingCoupler(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material GC'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 3 entries:
        Example: Parameters['Material GC'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material', 'Photonic Wire Bonding']
        Example: Parameters['Material GC'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut", "Si (Silicon) - Palik"]

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Grating Coupler Geometry ---
    Parameters["Length GC"] : float
        Length of the grating coupler area.
    Parameters["Width GC"] : float
        Width of the grating coupler area.
    Parameters["Height GC"] : float
        Height of the grating coupler material.
    Parameters["Etch Depth GC"] : float
        Etch depth of the gratings (from Height GC).
    Parameters["Duty Cycle"] : float
        Duty cycle of the gratings. For example, 0.39 → 39% duty cycle.
    Parameters["Pitch GC"] : float
        Pitch of the grating coupler. Example: 0.6e-6 → 0.6 µm total pitch.
    Parameters["Input Length GC"] : float
        Square waveguide before the grating coupler with same WG Height.
    Parameters["Output Length GC"] : float
        Square waveguide after the grating coupler to finish the structure.

    --- Waveguide ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height; also the height of the MMI section.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Waveguide width. In this function, also the inverse taper width.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Slab height.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Angle of waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        Used only if Parameters["Taper"] = True.

    --- Taper ---
    Parameters["Taper"] : bool
        If True, creates an input taper to the grating coupler.
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper.

    --- Single Mode Fiber (SMF) ---
    Parameters["SMF Core Diameter"] : float
        SMF core diameter.
    Parameters["SMF Cladding Diameter"] : float
        SMF cladding diameter.
    Parameters["SMF Core Index"] : float
        SMF core refractive index.
    Parameters["SMF Cladding Index"] : float
        SMF cladding refractive index.
    Parameters["SMF Theta"] : float
        Tilting angle of the SMF to the grating coupler. Example: 15°.
    Parameters["SMF Z Span"] : float
        Length/span of the SMF.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
11:
Call RingGratingCoupler with -> obj.RingGratingCoupler(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Material GC'] : list of str
        List of valid Lumerical material names. Must contain at least 3 entries:
        Example: Parameters['Material GC'] = ['Cladding/Substrate', 'Object Material', 'Photonic Wire Bonding']
        Example: Parameters['Material GC'] = ["SiO2 (Glass) - Palik", "LiNbO3_20deg_X cut", "Si (Silicon) - Palik"]

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Grating Coupler Geometry ---
    Parameters["Length GC"] : float
        Length of the grating coupler area.
    Parameters["Width GC"] : float
        Width of the grating coupler area.
    Parameters["Height GC"] : float
        Height of the grating coupler material.
    Parameters["GC Radius"] : float
        Radius of the ring grating coupler (µm). Example: 25e-6
    Parameters["Etch Depth GC"] : float
        Etch depth of the gratings (from Height GC).
    Parameters["Duty Cycle"] : float
        Duty cycle of the gratings. Example: 0.39 → 39% duty cycle.
    Parameters["Pitch GC"] : float
        Pitch of the grating coupler. Example: 0.6e-6 → 0.6 µm total pitch.
    Parameters["Input Length GC"] : float
        Square waveguide before the grating coupler with same WG Height.
    Parameters["Output Length GC"] : float
        Square waveguide after the grating coupler to finish the structure.

    --- Waveguide ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height; also the height of the MMI section.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Waveguide width.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Slab height.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Angle of waveguide walls, calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Single Mode Fiber (SMF) ---
    Parameters["SMF Core Diameter"] : float
        SMF core diameter.
    Parameters["SMF Cladding Diameter"] : float
        SMF cladding diameter.
    Parameters["SMF Core Index"] : float
        SMF core refractive index.
    Parameters["SMF Cladding Index"] : float
        SMF cladding refractive index.
    Parameters["SMF Theta"] : float
        Tilting angle of the SMF to the grating coupler. Normally 15°.
    Parameters["SMF Z Span"] : float
        Length/span of the SMF.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
12:
Call StraightWaveguide with -> obj.MZM(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters["Optical"] : dict of str
        Optical materials dataset.
        Example: Parameters["Optical"] = ["Au (Gold) - CRC", "SiO2 (Glass) - Palik"]
    Parameters["Electrical"] : dict of str
        Electrical materials dataset.
        Example: Parameters["Electrical"] = ["Air", "Au (Gold) - CRC", "LiNbO3 semiconductor - X/Y cut (Lithium Niobate)", "SiO2 (Glass) - Sze"]

    --- Waveguide Geometry ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height in micrometers.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Top width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide; determines the structure length.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Side angle of the waveguide (WG_angle = 90 - angle).
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the material slab. Can be set to 0 if no slab is present.

    --- Electrodes ---
    Parameters["GND Electrodes Width"] : float
        Width of the ground electrodes.
    Parameters["Signal Electrodes Width"] : float
        Width of the signal electrodes.
    Parameters["Electrodes Height"] : float
        Height of the metal electrodes.
    Parameters["Gap"] : float
        Gap between the waveguide and the electrodes, measured from the bottom WG corner to the electrodes.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
13:
Call Waveguide_Charge with -> obj.Waveguide_Charge(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- General ---
    Parameters : dict
        Dictionary containing all the parameters required for MZM creation.

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters["Optical"] : dict of str
        Optical materials dataset.
        Example: Parameters["Optical"] = ["Au (Gold) - CRC", "SiO2 (Glass) - Palik"]
    Parameters["Electrical"] : dict of str
        Electrical materials dataset.
        Example: Parameters["Electrical"] = ["Air", "Au (Gold) - CRC", "LiNbO3 semiconductor - X/Y cut", "SiO2 (Glass) - Sze"]

    --- Waveguide Geometry ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height in micrometers.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Top width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide; determines the structure length.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Side angle of the waveguide (WG_angle = 90 - angle).
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the material slab. Can be set to 0 if no slab is present.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
